channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Forest back on track under Dyche - but worries for Leeds?
item.description: Nottingham Forest, the Tricky Trees as they are known to their fans, are starting to show shoots of revival.

item.title: Guehi, Pope and Gordon set to miss England games
item.description: Marc Guehi, Nick Pope and Anthony Gordon are expected to miss England's final two World Cup qualifying games through injury.

item.title: The 'mentality shift' that has helped Man City to top of WSL
item.description: Khadija Shaw says Manchester City have had a "mentality shift" this season, after moving top of the Women's Super League.

item.title: 'Up to players to decide our limit' - London City dream big
item.description: London City Lionesses' thrilling 4-2 win over Tottenham feels like a watershed moment in their debut Women's Super League campaign.

item.title: Sunderland battle for draw as Arsenal's winning streak ends
item.description: Brian Brobbey scores a dramatic injury-time equaliser for Sunderland against Arsenal, who concede their first goals since September to end a run of 10 consecutive wins in all competitions.

item.title: Chelsea see off managerless Wolves to move up to second
item.description: Alejandro Garnacho stars for Chelsea in a comfortable 3-0 win over managerless Wolves at Stamford Bridge, as the home side move up to second in the Premier League table.

item.title: Spurs and Man Utd share points after chaotic climax
item.description: Matthijs De Ligt scores an equaliser deep in to stoppage time, cancelling out Richarlison's 91st minute goal as Tottenham and Manchester United play out a 2-2 draw.

item.title: West Ham produce comeback to beat relegation rivals Burnley
item.description: West Ham come from a goal down to beat Burnley 3-2 at the London Stadium, as Nuno Espirito Santo's side earn a second consecutive win for the first time this season in the Premier League.

item.title: Everton end winless run with victory over Fulham
item.description: Goals from Idrissa Gueye and Michael Keane help Everton end their three-match winless run with a 2-0 win over Fulham at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

item.title: Advertising boards and chaos - how Sunderland stopped Arsenal machine
item.description: Sunderland halt Arsenal's winning run to give hope to the Premier League chasing pack, with the way they stifled the leaders catching the eye.

item.title: Miedema & Shaw star as Man City beat Everton to go top
item.description: Goals from Vivianne Miedema and Khadija Shaw help Man City beat Everton 2-1 at Goodison Park and move top of the Women's Super League table.

item.title: 'It's a good marker for us' - Dyche on first PL win with Forest
item.description: Sean Dyche says he is "very pleased" with his side's performance after Nottingham Forest come from a goal down to beat Leeds United 3-1 at the City Ground.

item.title: Brighton deny Liverpool first WSL win with stoppage-time equaliser
item.description: Rosa Kafaji scores a 93rd-minute equaliser for Brighton to deny Liverpool their first WSL win of the season.

item.title: Brilliant Ballard epitomises everything Sunderland do well - Shearer
item.description: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer praises the performance of Sunderland defender Dan Ballard in the Black Cats' 2-2 draw against Premier League leaders Arsenal at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: Godfrey nets twice as London City beat Spurs in six-goal thriller
item.description: Freya Godfrey scores twice as London City Lionesses get the better of Tottenham Hotspur in a back-and-forth 4-2 win for the home side at Hayes Lane in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Norway footballer facing conviction for sharing illegal video
item.description: Norway international Andreas Schjelderup says he is facing conviction for illegally sharing a video.

item.title: 'Work hard' - is Maresca's message bringing back peak Garnacho?
item.description: Alejandro Garnacho was exiled at Manchester United under Ruben Amorim but two goals and two assists in four games highlight his improving form at Chelsea.

item.title: Nandy apologises for breaking rules on football regulator appointment
item.description: Report finds that new football regulator chair David Kogan had made two separate donations of £1,450 to the culture secretary.

item.title: Drab to dramatic - but questions for Spurs & Man Utd after 'strange' draw
item.description: A dramatic - or drab - Saturday lunchtime Premier League match with as many questions as answers, and for Manchester United a major injury scare.

item.title: West Ham 'take small step' with win after fan protest
item.description: Saturday starts with 10,000 West Ham fans protesting with a coffin and hearse - but ends with the Hammers boosting their chances of avoiding relegation.

item.title: Spurs eye move for Everton winger Ndiaye - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Tottenham target Everton winger Iliman Ndiaye, Chelsea set to rival Spurs for Juventus striker Jonathan David, and Liverpool linked with £88m move for Inter's Alessandro Bastoni.

item.title: Norwich sack Manning after seventh home loss
item.description: Norwich City sack head coach Liam Manning after just 17 games in charge following a seventh successive home Championship defeat.

item.title: Edwards to hold Wolves talks as deal agreed with Middlesbrough
item.description: Middlesbrough agree a deal with Wolves for boss Rob Edwards and grant him permission to speak to the Premier League club.

item.title: Slegers calls for VAR after Arsenal goals ruled out in draw with Chelsea
item.description: Arsenal manager Renee Slegers calls for the introduction of VAR in the WSL after a 1-1 draw with Chelsea.

item.title: Man Utd 'flat' but Skinner will not 'overemphasise' defeat
item.description: Manchester United head coach Marc Skinner laments a "flat" WSL defeat by Aston Villa, but will not 'overemphasise' the performance to his players.

item.title: Edwards leaving and Cleverley under pressure - EFL takeaways
item.description: Final Score pundit Sam Parkin gives his five takeaways from Saturday's EFL action.

item.title: Aluko says 'justice served' after Barton convicted
item.description: Pundit Eni Aluko responds after Joey Barton is found guilty of sending grossly offensive posts on X.

item.title: Hayes on her feminist dad, anxiety and feeling like a grandparent to players
item.description: Emma Hayes sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about her childhood, working as a national team boss and balancing football with family.

item.title: 'Tuchel and England's world will not revolve around Bellingham'
item.description: Jude Bellingham still has a point to prove despite being recalled to Thomas Tuchel's England squad, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'Arsenal attack like 'Invincibles' and defend like class of 97-98'
item.description: They have won nothing yet, but this Arsenal side reminds me of the ones I won three league titles with, writes Martin Keown.

item.title: Earps reaction 'shows pressure on women to be perfect angels'
item.description: In her latest column, Anita Asante looks at how we react to role models not conforming in women's football and the fallout from Mary Earps' book.

item.title: Who do fans think is the key player in each Premier League team?
item.description: From the "soul of the team" to an "absolute warrior", here are the Premier League's 20 key players, as chosen by our fan writers.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why can Channel Islands players play for England?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why players born in the Channel Islands like Alex Scott can represent England at a senior level.

item.title: What is the Fifa Peace Prize?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Peace Prize is and why US President Donald Trump is being tipped for the award.

item.title: What are the Fifa Best Awards?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifa Best Awards are, who can vote and who the nominees are.

item.title: Why do footballers tape up their wrists?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains why footballers use tape to wrap their wrists.

item.title: Who are the youngest Champions League players?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at the youngest players have ever played in the Champions League

item.title: What is a ghostwriter after Earps' book backlash?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a book is ghostwritten.

item.title: Where are England's U17 World Cup winners now?
item.description: Ever wondered what happened to England's U17 World Cup-winning side from 2017? BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains...

item.title: 'Celtic eye Man City goalkeeper Ortega' - gossip
item.description: Manchester City's Stefan Ortega and Liverpool's Andy Robertson are linked with January moves to Celtic as Bodo/Glimt head coach Kjetil Knutsen is reportedly keen on a switch to the Scottish champions.

item.title: Bellingham and Mbappe shine as Real Madrid thrash Valencia
item.description: Jude Bellingham scores and Kylian Mbappe nets twice as Real Madrid open up a seven-point lead in La Liga with a comfortable win over Valencia at Santiago Bernabeu.

item.title: Head coach Vieira leaves bottom club Genoa
item.description: Patrick Vieira leaves his role as Genoa head coach by mutual consent after they fail to win in nine Serie A games this season.

item.title: Vinicius Jr no longer feels 'untouchable' - so what's going on?
item.description: Vinicius Jr no longer feels untouchable at Real Madrid and recent events are a truce, not a resolution, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
